verb.description: Engrave (metal, glass, or stone) by coating it with a protective layer, drawing on it with a needle, and then covering it with acid to attack the parts the needle has exposed, especially in order to produce prints from it.
examples: aquatint is a process of achieving tone by etching a metal plate

verb.description: (of an acid or other solvent) corrode or eat away the surface of (something).
Cut or carve (a text or design) on a surface.
examples: her initials were etched on the table
his name is etched in baseball history

noun.description: The action or process of etching something.

origin: Mid 17th century: from Dutch etsen, from German ätzen, from a base meaning cause to eat; related to eat.
